Upon logging into your student assigned Chromebook, you may have noticed a login page for “ClassLink”. ClassLink provides “OneClick”, which enables single sign-on (SSO) access to web and Windows applications that the district has signed up for staff and students to use.

ClassLink is ideal for 1:1 initiatives, which Valley Central School District currently offering. ClassLink connects many district software and cloud accounts to one interface, which also stores usernames and passwords. This means no more needing to remember them, write them down, or access multiple lists around the buildings.

Login for students and staff is the same as they use when they log in to any district computer.

If you need a refresher, or if it is the first time a student is logging in, visit our VC Digital Parent Resources Website for useful information about how to log in.
https://sites.google.com/vcsdny.org/vcdigitalparentresources/home

The New York State Public High School Athletic Association, Inc. (NYSPHSAA) has announced its 2019-20 Scholar-Athlete School of Distinction and School of Excellence Award winners, and Valley Central is among the 56 NYS Schools that earned the School of Distinction Award.

NYSPHSAA has created two levels of awards based on the percentage of varsity teams a school district has that qualifies and earns the Scholar-Athlete team Award. A School of Excellence has 75% of varsity teams qualify and earn that status while a School of Distinction has 100% of its varsity teams qualified for and received the Scholar-Athlete team award during their respective sports seasons. Valley Central had all 12 Varsity Teams in Fall 2019 and Winter 2020 qualify and earn Scholar-Athlete team Awards (NYSPHSAA did not consider Spring 2020 teams due to the COVID closure).

Congratulations to all our athletes, coaches and Athletic Director, Bill Miller!

The VCHS Revelation staff, advised by Melissa Bonacic and Karen Morris, is very excited for the release of the 2020 edition of our Revelation magazine! What you may not know is that VC doesn’t just stand for Valley Central; it also stands for “very creative,” which we certainly had to be during these unprecedented times. Because we were unable to produce printed copies of the magazine this year due to our school closing during this pandemic, we worked hard to produce this online edition of the magazine, the first one (and hopefully the last one) ever. We did not want the work of many of our talented students to go unseen, especially those pieces created by our graduating seniors.

We would like to thank Superintendent John Xanthis and Principal Jayme Ginda-Baxter for their continued support, and for allowing us the opportunity to share and highlight the many artistic and literary talents of our students. #VCProud

We hope you enjoy the magazine!

The NYS Governor announced a change to the voting procedure for school districts, which he delivered an Executive Order for on June 8, 2020. According to the order;

Ballots can be delivered by voters in person until 5:00 p.m. on June 9th. After that time, no drop boxes may be provided for voters to deliver ballots in person.

Ballots received in the mail until June 16th at 5:00 p.m., regardless of when/if it was postmarked, can be canvassed and counted.

The district cannot begin canvassing or counting the ballots until after 5:00 p.m. on June 16th. The district can choose to start canvassing on June 17th if desired.

Masks must be worn if a voter chooses to drop off a ballot in accordance with the Governor’s order regarding face masks. Ballot boxes are located at every district building and the times are posted on the Budget webpage, the 2020-2021 Proposed Budget webpage, and the 2020 Annual Budget and BOE Election webpage.

For more information: https://www.vcsd.k12.ny.us/board-of-education/2020-budget-vote-and-boe-election/

The Backpack Snack Attack Program has been at Valley Central since 2010 and has been a labor of love for our Attendance Teacher and Homeless Liaison, Barbara Gravel who works in conjunction with the First Reformed Church in Walden.

This program provides bags of food for 139 students needing food assistance every weekend to help fill the gap when school meals are not available.

During the COVID-19 Crisis, Barbara Gravel made sure that those bags were still delivered. Our custodial staff have been delivering them to the homes of the students since the shut-down.

We are grateful to Barb for her hard work always going above and beyond. We are also grateful to the First Reformed Church of Walden and all the local volunteers who pack these bags faithfully every week even during this crisis.

For more information on the program or if you are interested in volunteering, please visit: https://waldenfirstreformed.org/local-missions/

Kelly Conan, a Junior at VCHS wanted to do something to help in the fight of COVID and decided to try to lift the spirits of the entire community.

Kelly wrote letters wrapped in green ribbon and left them in her neighbor's mailboxes. She asked them to tie the ribbon around a mailbox or a tree to remind everyone that not only are we all in this together, but COVID-19 is causing us to all grow personally and as a community as she said, "This time has a period of growth and renewal for many of us in that we have changed our lifestyles drastically to help prevent the spread of the virus."

Kelly is hoping that her "Green Ribbon Movement" can expand beyond just her neighborhood so she is sharing the letter and photos hoping others around the community will join in by hanging green ribbons (hopefully they may have some, or something else they can use) themselves in their neighborhoods.
